name: ConnectedAppPlugin
description: Contains methods for extending the behavior of a connected app, for example, customizing how a connected app is invoked depending on the protocol used. This class gives you more control over the interaction between Salesforce and your connected app.

authorize(id,id,boolean).name: authorize
authorize(id,id,boolean).signature: public Boolean authorize(Id userId, Id connectedAppId, Boolean isAdminApproved)
authorize(id,id,boolean).overrideSignature: public override Boolean authorize(Id userId, Id connectedAppId, Boolean isAdminApproved)
authorize(id,id,boolean).description: Deprecated and available only in API versions 35.0 and 36.0. As of version 37.0, use authorize(userId, connectedAppId, isAdminApproved, context) instead.

isadminapproved.name: isAdminApproved
isadminapproved.description: The 15-character ID of the user attempting to use the connected app. The 15-character ID of the connected app. The approval state of the specified user when the connected app requires approval.

authorize(id,id,boolean,auth.invocationc.name: authorize
authorize(id,id,boolean,auth.invocationc.signature: public Boolean authorize(Id userId, Id connectedAppId, Boolean isAdminApproved, Auth.InvocationContext context)
authorize(id,id,boolean,auth.invocationc.overrideSignature: public override Boolean authorize(Id userId, Id connectedAppId, Boolean isAdminApproved, Auth.InvocationContext context)
authorize(id,id,boolean,auth.invocationc.description: Authorizes the specified user to access the connected app. If the connected app is set for users to self-authorize, this method isn’t invoked.

context.name: context
context.description: The 15-character ID of the user attempting to use the connected app. The 15-character ID of the connected app. The approval state of the specified user when the connected app requires approval. The context in which the connected app is invoked.

customattributes(id,id,map<string,string.name: customAttributes
customattributes(id,id,map<string,string.signature: public Map<String,String> customAttributes(Id userId, Id connectedAppId, Map<String,String> formulaDefinedAttributes)
customattributes(id,id,map<string,string.overrideSignature: public override Map<String,String> customAttributes(Id userId, Id connectedAppId, Map<String,String> formulaDefinedAttributes)
customattributes(id,id,map<string,string.description: Deprecated and available only in API versions 35.0 and 36.0. As of version 37.0, use customAttributes(userId, connectedAppId, formulaDefinedAttributes, context) instead.

formuladefinedattributes.name: formulaDefinedAttributes
formuladefinedattributes.description: The 15-character ID of the user attempting to use the connected app. The 15-character ID of the connected app. A map of the new set of attributes from the UserInfo endpoint (OAuth) or from a SAML assertion. For more information, see The UserInfo Endpoint in the online help.

customattributes(id,id,map<string,string.name: customAttributes
customattributes(id,id,map<string,string.signature: public Map<String,String> customAttributes(Id userId, Id connectedAppId, Map<String,String> formulaDefinedAttributes, Auth.InvocationContext context)
customattributes(id,id,map<string,string.overrideSignature: public override Map<String,String> customAttributes(Id userId, Id connectedAppId, Map<String,String> formulaDefinedAttributes, Auth.InvocationContext context)
customattributes(id,id,map<string,string.description: Sets new attributes for the specified user. When the connected app gets the user’s attributes from the UserInfo endpoint or through a SAML assertion, use this method to update the attribute values.

formuladefinedattributes.name: formulaDefinedAttributes
formuladefinedattributes.description: The 15-character ID of the user attempting to use the connected app. The 15-character ID for the connected app. A map of the current set of attributes from the UserInfo endpoint (OAuth) or from a SAML assertion. For more information, see The UserInfo Endpoint in the online help. The context in which the connected app is invoked.

modifysamlresponse(map<string,string>,id.name: modifySAMLResponse
modifysamlresponse(map<string,string>,id.signature: public dom.XmlNode modifySAMLResponse(Map<String,String> authSession, Id connectedAppId, dom.XmlNode samlResponse)
modifysamlresponse(map<string,string>,id.overrideSignature: public override dom.XmlNode modifySAMLResponse(Map<String,String> authSession, Id connectedAppId, dom.XmlNode samlResponse)
modifysamlresponse(map<string,string>,id.description: Modifies the XML generated by the Salesforce SAML Identity Provider (IDP) before it’s sent to the service provider.

samlresponse.name: samlResponse
samlresponse.description: The attributes for the authorized user’s session. The map includes the 15-character ID of the authorized user who’s accessing the connected app. The 15-character ID of the connected app. Contains the SAML XML response generated by the IDP.

refresh(id,id).name: refresh
refresh(id,id).signature: public void refresh(Id userId, Id connectedAppId)
refresh(id,id).overrideSignature: public override void refresh(Id userId, Id connectedAppId)
refresh(id,id).description: Deprecated and available only in API versions 35.0 and 36.0. As of version 37.0, use refresh(userId, connectedAppId, context) instead.

connectedappid.name: connectedAppId
connectedappid.description: The 15-character ID of the user requesting the refresh token. The 15-character ID of the connected app.

refresh(id,id,auth.invocationcontext).name: refresh
refresh(id,id,auth.invocationcontext).signature: public void refresh(Id userId, Id connectedAppId, Auth.InvocationContext context)
refresh(id,id,auth.invocationcontext).overrideSignature: public override void refresh(Id userId, Id connectedAppId, Auth.InvocationContext context)
refresh(id,id,auth.invocationcontext).description: Salesforce calls this method during a refresh token exchange.

context.name: context
context.description: The 15-character ID of the user requesting the refresh token. The 15-character ID of the connected app. The context in which the connected app is invoked.
